title: Calories in Imitation Crab
meta_description: Learn calories in imitation crab per 100g serving, including carbs, protein, fat, sodium, and full nutrition facts for easy meal planning.
assumptions: Standard imitation crab (surimi-based seafood sticks), commercial product, plain without added sauces or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, processing, ingredients, and portion size; check product labels for accurate values.

quick_answer.text: Imitation crab provides about 95 kcal per 100g, mainly from carbs with moderate protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Mixed with 50g cooked rice per 100g crab

faqs.q: How many calories in imitation crab per serving?
faqs.a: About 95 kcal per 100g serving of plain imitation crab.

faqs.q: What is the protein content in imitation crab?
faqs.a: Roughly 8g protein per 100g, lower than real crab due to fish paste base.

faqs.q: Why is sodium high in imitation crab?
faqs.a: Processing adds salt for flavor and texture; about 800mg per 100g.
Yes, around 15g per 100g from added starch binders, unlike real crab.

faqs.q: Is imitation crab low in fat?
faqs.a: Very low at 0.5g fat per 100g, making it a lean seafood alternative.
